definition: to flee in defeat/to bolt
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
desolate/shortage/scarce/out of practice/absurd/uncultivated/to neglect
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to escape/to run away/to flee

sentences.english: After the fight, I ran away too.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭結束後，我也落荒而逃。

sentences.english: The wolf was beaten by the farmer. He ran howling away.
sentences.chinese: 農夫把狼痛打一頓，狼便嗥叫地落荒而逃。

sentences.english: Derek and everyone else in the church flees.
sentences.chinese: 德里克和教堂裏的其他人落荒而逃。

sentences.english: Yes, the money changers have fled from their high seats in the temple of our civiIization.
sentences.chinese: 如今，貨幣兌換商已從我們文明廟宇的高處落荒而逃。

definition: to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
in a panic/flurried
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
variant of 倉皇|仓皇[cang1 huang2]
to escape without trace (idiom); to make one's getaway (from the scene of a crime)/to show a clean pair of heels
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
to escape/to flee/to run for one's life
utterly defeated
to escape/to flee/to run away
to flee at the mere sight of (idiom)
dull gray/gloomy/dejected/crestfallen/with one's tail between one's legs
in a difficult situation/to cut a sorry figure/scoundrel! (derog.)
to run away/to take to one's heels
to be scared out of one's wits/to scare stiff
to flee/to run away
to flee from sth/to run away/to escape
